metadata.title: CVE-2021-47594 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: mptcp:never allow the PM to close a listener subflow Currently, when deleting anendpoint the netlink PM treverses all the local MPTCP sockets, regardlessof their status. If an MPTCP listener socket is bound to the IP matchingthe delete endpoint, the listener TCP socket will be closed. That isunexpected, the PM should only affect data subflows. Additionally, syzbotwas able to trigger a NULL ptr dereference due to the above: generalprotection fault, probably for non-canonical address 0xdffffc0000000003:0000 [#1] PREEMPT SMP KASAN KASAN:
